comments:
If a JUnit test (with modeled behavior) is placed in the default package, test 
execution fails with a claa not foudn exception.  The class that can not be 
found is the classname of the test preceded by a period.

I think that line 161 of 
org.eclipse.hyades.test.common.internal.codegen.Helper.java is the culprit, 
but I haven't tested a fix.

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: .JUnit1
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:375)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:562)
	at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:442)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:494)
	at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:260)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.test.java.runner.HyadesJUnitRunner.main
(HyadesJUnitRunner.java:124)

Hi Joe,
In TPTP 3.3, the UI won't let you select the default package when you attempt to
generate the code for a JUnit test suite, so I assumed that you found the bug in
4.0, not 3.3. Let me know if you really observed this problem in 3.3.
As far as 4.0 is concerned, I did not reproduce this exact problem: instead of
having the exception you report at runtime, the problem appears sooner, at code
generation time (an incorrect import is generated in the code, when you insert a
test invocation in the test behavior). I fixed it and it now seems that
everything is OK (including execution).
Since I did not observe the exact problems that you reported, I may have missed
something. It would be cool if you could try again now and confirm that the
problem you were seeing does not happen any more. Thank you!

Hi Julien,

I definitely marked the defect incorrectly -- it was in 4.0 that I encountered 
this problem.  I'm not sure why I put it as 3.3.

I believe I also encountered the incorrect import, but removed it from the 
generated code, at which point I encountered the reported defect.

Sorry for the lousy bug report...
Thanks Joe. I've updated the version field.
